questions.question: How long does the treatment last?
questions.answer: The duration of treatment is determined according to each patient's condition. The average course lasts 7-14 days, but this period may be extended in complex cases.

questions.question: What documents are required for treatment?
questions.answer: Passport, medical insurance policy, and previous examination results if available are required. Visa and registration documents are also necessary for foreign citizens.

questions.question: How is the food organized during treatment?
questions.answer: Special diet meals are prepared for patients in our clinic. An individually tailored nutrition plan is provided for each patient.

questions.question: What are the treatment prices?
questions.answer: Prices vary depending on the services provided and the duration of treatment. You can contact our clinic to find out exact prices.

questions.question: What preparation is needed before treatment?
questions.answer: It is recommended to undergo all examinations prescribed by the doctor and take recommended medications before treatment.

questions.question: What specialists work in the clinic?
questions.answer: Our clinic employs highly qualified doctors, including therapists, neurologists, cardiologists, physiotherapists, and other specialists.

questions.question: Can my relatives visit me during treatment?
questions.answer: Yes, your relatives can visit you during designated visiting hours. You can get information about visiting hours from our clinic administration.

questions.question: What recommendations should be followed after treatment?
questions.answer: It is recommended to strictly follow all recommendations given by the doctor, come for control examinations at the appointed time, and if necessary, adhere to the diet and physical activity regimen.

maslahatlar.title: What to Expect After Hair Transplantation: Recovery, Results, and Helpful Tips
maslahatlar.content:
If you're considering hair transplantation, understanding the recovery process is just as important as the procedure itself. In this post, we'll walk you through what happens after hair transplantation and how to care for your new hair to achieve the best results.

1. Immediate Care

It's normal to experience mild swelling, redness, and scabbing in the treated area after the procedure. Your doctor will provide detailed instructions on how to clean your scalp and when to start washing your hair again. It's recommended not to touch, scratch, or wear headgear on the treated area for the first few days.

2. Shedding Phase

Don't worry if your newly transplanted hair begins to fall out after 2-3 weeks - this is completely normal. This is called 'shock loss' and is a temporary part of the healing process. New, stronger hair will begin to grow in its place.

3. Hair Growth Timeline

‚Ä¢ 3-4 months: Fine hairs begin to appear.

‚Ä¢ 6 months: Noticeable improvement and thickening of strands.

‚Ä¢ 12 months and beyond: Full results become visible.

Everyone's hair grows at different rates, but by one year, most patients enjoy a full head of hair with a natural appearance.

4. Tips for Fast and Healthy Recovery

‚Ä¢ Follow all aftercare instructions from your clinic completely.

‚Ä¢ Avoid strenuous physical activity for at least one week.

‚Ä¢ Stay hydrated and maintain a healthy diet.

‚Ä¢ Be patient ‚Äî hair growth takes time.

Ready to start your hair restoration journey? Contact our clinic today for a free consultation with one of our specialists.
